items.title: Afghanistan earthquake: Taliban appeal for aid as death toll rises to 900
items.standfirst: Rescuers search into the night for people trapped under debris of mud and stone homes in steep valleysThe Taliban have called for international aid as Afghanistan reels from an earthquake that killed more than 900 people and left thousands injured.Rescuers searched into the night on Monday for survivors after the 6.0-magnitude quake struck on Sunday destroying entire villages across the country’s eastern Kunar province, which borders Pakistan. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Rescuers in Afghanistan race to reach remote quake-hit mountain villages
Rescuers scramble to reach remote areas of Afghanistan after devastating quake
items.standfirst: Villagers in the quake-hit regions of eastern Afghanistan joined rescue workers Tuesday in a desperate search for survivors of a 6.0 magnitude earthquake that killed more than 800 people. Foreign aid has been slashed since the 2021 return of the Taliban and the latest disaster has worsened Afghanistan's protracted humanitarian crisis.
items.content: Villagers in the quake-hit regions of eastern Afghanistan joined rescue workers Tuesday in a desperate search for survivors of a 6.0 magnitude earthquake that killed more than 800 people. Foreign aid has been slashed since the 2021 return of the Taliban and the latest disaster has worsened Afghanistan's protracted humanitarian crisis.

items.title: Afghanistan earthquake ravaged remote areas, hampering recovery
items.standfirst: At least 800 people are dead and more than 2,500 are injured after a strong earthquake hit a mountainous area of Afghanistan late Sunday night. The BBC's Yogita Limaye reports.
items.content: At least 800 people are dead and more than 2,500 are injured after a strong earthquake hit a mountainous area of Afghanistan late Sunday night. The BBC's Yogita Limaye reports.

items.content: An earthquake with a magnitude of 6 hit eastern Afghanistan, destroying multiple villages and killing more than 800 people, officials say.

items.content: Rescue workers are searching for victims of a 6.0 magnitude earthquake that struck eastern Afghanistan in the middle of the night. More than 800 people were killed. Elizabeth Palmer has the latest.

items.title: Afghanistan earthquake kills more than 800, flattens villages
items.standfirst: A massive rescue operation was underway in Afghanistan on Monday, after a strong earthquake collapsed homes onto sleeping families in a remote, mountainous region, killing more than 800 people with the toll expected to rise, Taliban authorities said. FRANCE 24's Shahzaib Wahlah reports from Islamabad.
items.content: A massive rescue operation was underway in Afghanistan on Monday, after a strong earthquake collapsed homes onto sleeping families in a remote, mountainous region, killing more than 800 people with the toll expected to rise, Taliban authorities said. FRANCE 24's Shahzaib Wahlah reports from Islamabad.

items.title: ‘There is death in every home’, families say, after at least 800 killed in Afghanistan earthquake – as it happened
items.standfirst: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says public health ministry, as rescue operations take place. This live blog is closedMagnitude 6 earthquake hits eastern AfghanistanHow have you been affected by the earthquake?One resident in Afghanistan’s Nurgal district, one of the worst-affected areas in Kunar, said almost the entire village had collapsed under the force of the earthquake. “Children are under the rubble. The elderly are under the rubble. Young people are under the rubble,” the villager, who did not give his name, told the Associated Press.“We need help here,” he pleaded. “We need people to come here and join us. Let us pull out the people who are buried. There is no one who can come and remove dead bodies from under the rubble.” Continue reading...
items.content: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says public health ministry, as rescue operations take place. This live blog is closedMagnitude 6 earthquake hits eastern AfghanistanHow have you been affected by the earthquake?One resident in Afghanistan’s Nurgal district, one of the worst-affected areas in Kunar, said almost the entire village had collapsed under the force of the earthquake. “Children are under the rubble. The elderly are under the rubble. Young people are under the rubble,” the villager, who did not give his name, told the Associated Press.“We need help here,” he pleaded. “We need people to come here and join us. Let us pull out the people who are buried. There is no one who can come and remove dead bodies from under the rubble.” Continue reading...

items.title: At least 800 dead after magnitude-6 earthquake hits eastern Afghanistan
items.standfirst: Rescuers try to reach people trapped under mud and debris while hampered by destroyed roads and steep terrainA powerful earthquake that hit mountainous eastern Afghanistan has left at least 800 people confirmed dead and injured about 2,500, Taliban officials have said as rescuers struggled to reach the worst-hit villages.The magnitude-6 earthquake struck several provinces close to the Pakistan border around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged region of Kunar the most severely affected. There were landslides and flooding. Continue reading...
items.content: Rescuers try to reach people trapped under mud and debris while hampered by destroyed roads and steep terrainA powerful earthquake that hit mountainous eastern Afghanistan has left at least 800 people confirmed dead and injured about 2,500, Taliban officials have said as rescuers struggled to reach the worst-hit villages.The magnitude-6 earthquake struck several provinces close to the Pakistan border around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged region of Kunar the most severely affected. There were landslides and flooding. Continue reading...

items.content: More than 800 people have been killed and at least 2,800 others injured after an earthquake hit eastern Afghanistan, according to Taliban state officials.

items.title: An earthquake devastates eastern Afghanistan, killing more than 800 people
items.standfirst: The 6.0 magnitude quake late Sunday hit a series of towns in the province of Kunar, near the city of Jalalabad in neighboring Nangahar province, causing extensive damage.
items.content: The 6.0 magnitude quake late Sunday hit a series of towns in the province of Kunar, near the city of Jalalabad in neighboring Nangahar province, causing extensive damage.(Image credit: Hedayat Shah)

items.title: At least 800 killed as powerful earthquake rocks Afghanistan
items.standfirst: At least 800 people have been killed and over 1,000 have been injured in Afghanistan after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake hit the country, Taliban officials said Monday.
items.content: At least 800 people have been killed and over 1,000 have been injured in Afghanistan after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake hit the country, Taliban officials said Monday.

ai_summary: A 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan, causing significant damage and loss of life.
The Taliban appealed for international aid as rescue efforts commenced in affected areas.
Over 800 people were reported dead, with thousands injured in the mountainous region.
Entire villages were destroyed, and rescuers struggled to reach remote, isolated areas.
The disaster worsened Afghanistan's ongoing humanitarian crisis, impacting recovery efforts.

items.title: Xi Jinping criticises ‘bullying behaviour’ and Putin blames west for Ukraine war at Shanghai summit
items.standfirst: China’s leader urges attendees to oppose ‘cold war mentality’ while Russian president claims Ukraine war was ‘provoked by the west’Xi Jinping has criticised the “bullying behaviour” of other countries while Vladimir Putin has blamed the west for his war on Ukraine, on the second day of a major summit in China which seeks to challenge western-led multilateral blocs.The Shanghai Cooperation Summit (SCO) began in the city of Tianjin on Sunday, with Xi welcoming dozens of leaders from Eurasian member states and other partner and observer countries, including Putin, and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: India looks to mend ties with China as Trump's tariffs push it away from U.S.
items.standfirst: Five years after deadly border clashes plunged relations to an all-time low, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is headed to China, as President Donald Trump’s tariffs alienate New Delhi and stoke worries that the U.S.’s counterweight to China might actually be getting closer to it instead.
items.content: Five years after deadly border clashes plunged relations to an all-time low, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is headed to China, as President Donald Trump’s tariffs alienate New Delhi and stoke worries that the U.S.’s counterweight to China might actually be getting closer to it instead.

clusters.title: Landslide levels village in Sudan's Darfur region, kills roughly 1,000
clusters.neutral_headline: Landslide in Sudan's Darfur Region Claims Over One Thousand Lives
bullet_summary: A landslide wiped out a village in Sudan 's Darfur region, killing an estimated 1,000 people, a rebel group controlling the area said
The landslide, which followed heavy rain, destroyed a village in the Marra Mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivor, said the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM)
More than 1,000 people are feared dead after a landslide in a village in western Sudan, the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM) has said

items.title: Trump says he will award Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom
items.standfirst: Former NYC mayor was sanctioned by courts and disbarred for amplifying false claims about the 2020 electionDonald Trump said Monday he will award Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian honor, two days after his longtime political ally was seriously injured in a car crash.The decision places the award on a man once lauded for leading New York after the September 11, 2001, attacks and later sanctioned by courts and disbarred for amplifying false claims about the 2020 US presidential election. Giuliani, the former New York mayor, was also criminally charged in two states; he has denied wrongdoing. Continue reading...
items.content: Former NYC mayor was sanctioned by courts and disbarred for amplifying false claims about the 2020 electionDonald Trump said Monday he will award Rudy Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation’s highest civilian honor, two days after his longtime political ally was seriously injured in a car crash.The decision places the award on a man once lauded for leading New York after the September 11, 2001, attacks and later sanctioned by courts and disbarred for amplifying false claims about the 2020 US presidential election. Giuliani, the former New York mayor, was also criminally charged in two states; he has denied wrongdoing. Continue reading...

items.title: Belgium says it will recognise Palestinian state at upcoming UN General Assembly
items.standfirst: After recent announcements by France, the UK, and Canada, Belgian Foreign Minister Maxime Prevot on Tuesday said his country will recognise the State of Palestine at the United Nations General Assembly this month, adding that it will impose "firm sanctions" on the Israeli government amid the "humanitarian tragedy" unfolding in Gaza.

They were later returned to the custody of the Office of Refugee Resettlement. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Leading international association says Israel is committing genocide in Gaza
clusters.neutral_headline: Genocide Scholars Say Israel Committing Genocide in Gaza
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, BBC World, Guardian World

items.title: Leading international association says Israel is committing genocide in Gaza
items.standfirst: The world's leading association of genocide scholars declared on Monday that Israel's ongoing actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of the crime. The report by the International Association of Genocide Scholars (IAGS) highlights the 50,000 children Israel has killed or wounded, as well as its widespread attacks on Gaza's healthcare, aid, and educational sectors, and said that Israel's response to Hamas' October 7, 2023, attacks does not solely target the Palestinian militant group but the entirety of Gaza's population.
items.content: The world's leading association of genocide scholars declared on Monday that Israel's ongoing actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of the crime. The report by the International Association of Genocide Scholars (IAGS) highlights the 50,000 children Israel has killed or wounded, as well as its widespread attacks on Gaza's healthcare, aid, and educational sectors, and said that Israel's response to Hamas' October 7, 2023, attacks does not solely target the Palestinian militant group but the entirety of Gaza's population.

items.title: Israel committing genocide in Gaza, world's leading experts say
items.standfirst: The world's leading association of genocide scholars cited several actions by Israel, including attacks on the healthcare sector and the killing of children.
items.content: The world's leading association of genocide scholars cited several actions by Israel, including attacks on the healthcare sector and the killing of children.

items.title: Israel committing genocide in Gaza, world’s top scholars on the crime say
items.standfirst: International Association of Genocide Scholars resolution backed by 86% of members who votedThe world’s leading genocide scholars’ association has backed a resolution stating that Israel’s actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of the crime.Out of the International Association of Genocide Scholars’s (IAGS) 500 members, 28% took part in the vote. Of those who voted, 86% supported the resolution. The resolution states that “Israel’s policies and actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide in article II of the United Nations convention for the prevention and punishment of the crime of genocide (1948).” Continue reading...
items.content: International Association of Genocide Scholars resolution backed by 86% of members who votedThe world’s leading genocide scholars’ association has backed a resolution stating that Israel’s actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of the crime.Out of the International Association of Genocide Scholars’s (IAGS) 500 members, 28% took part in the vote. Of those who voted, 86% supported the resolution. The resolution states that “Israel’s policies and actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide in article II of the United Nations convention for the prevention and punishment of the crime of genocide (1948).” Continue reading...

ai_summary: The International Association of Genocide Scholars issued a resolution.
The resolution stated Israel's actions in Gaza meet the legal definition.
The resolution was supported by a majority of voting members.
The resolution cited attacks on healthcare and the killing of children.
The scholars' association is a leading authority on genocide.

items.content: Tens of thousands of people gather in Hanoi to celebrate declaration of independence from French colonial rule.

items.title: Vietnam marks 80 years of independence in record celebrations
items.standfirst: Thousands packed the streets of Hanoi Tuesday to watch around 40,000 troops and civilians march in a military parade to mark Vietnam's 80 years of independence from French colonial rule.
items.content: Thousands packed the streets of Hanoi Tuesday to watch around 40,000 troops and civilians march in a military parade to mark Vietnam's 80 years of independence from French colonial rule.

ai_summary: Vietnam marked its 80th independence anniversary.
Tens of thousands gathered in Hanoi for celebrations.
The celebrations marked independence from French colonial rule.
A military parade was part of the celebrations.
Around 40,000 troops and civilians marched.

clusters.title: Metaplanet Holders Approve Fresh Funding Tools to Buy Bitcoin
clusters.neutral_headline: Metaplanet Holders Approve Bitcoin Funding Tools
bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, Bloomberg Technology

items.title: Metaplanet Holders Approve Fresh Funding Tools to Buy Bitcoin
Metaplanet Holders Approve New Funding Tools to Buy Bitcoin
items.standfirst: Japanese Bitcoin treasury Metaplanet Inc. secured shareholder approval for a proposal enabling it to raise as much as ¥555 billion ($3.8 billion) via preferred shares, in a bid to expand its financing options after its stock slumped.
items.content: Japanese Bitcoin treasury Metaplanet Inc. secured shareholder approval for a proposal enabling it to raise as much as ¥555 billion ($3.8 billion) via preferred shares, in a bid to expand its financing options after its stock slumped.

ai_summary: Metaplanet holders approved new funding tools.
The tools will be used to buy Bitcoin.
The company is a Japanese Bitcoin treasury.
They aim to raise up to ¥555 billion.
This is to expand financing options.

items.title: Democratic Rep. Jerry Nadler to retire from Congress
items.standfirst: Jerry Nadler, 78, was first elected to Congress in 1992 and told The New York Times in an interview that he plans to retire in 2026.
items.content: Jerry Nadler, 78, was first elected to Congress in 1992 and told The New York Times in an interview that he plans to retire in 2026.

items.title: Rep. Jerry Nadler announces retirement, citing Biden’s loss
items.standfirst: Rep. Jerry Nadler, the former chair of the House Judiciary Committee who helped spearhead President Donald Trump's impeachment, announced in an interview with The New York Timeson Monday that he won't seek re-election next year. The 78-year-old Democrat from New York, who has served in Congress…

Jerry Nadler, the former chair of the House Judiciary Committee who helped spearhead President Donald Trump's impeachment, announced in an interview with The New York Timeson Monday that he won't seek re-election next year. The 78-year-old Democrat from New York, who has served in Congress…

ai_summary: Representative Jerry Nadler announced his retirement.
He cited President Biden's loss as a factor.
Nadler was first elected to Congress in 1992.
He plans to retire in 2026.
He was the former chair of the House Judiciary Committee.

items.title: Alibaba-Backed Robot Firm Quicktron Is Said to File for Hong Kong IPO
Alibaba-Backed Robot Firm Quicktron Is Said to File for Hong Kong IPO
items.standfirst: Quicktron Robotics, a Chinese maker of self-driving forklifts and other robots used in warehouses, has confidentially filed for a Hong Kong initial public offering that could raise at least $100 million as early as next year, according to people familiar with the matter.
items.content: Quicktron Robotics, a Chinese maker of self-driving forklifts and other robots used in warehouses, has confidentially filed for a Hong Kong initial public offering that could raise at least $100 million as early as next year, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: Saudi Quick Delivery Startup Ninja Said to Seek Banks for IPO

items.content: Saudi Arabia-based quick delivery firm Ninja is looking to hire investment banks to advise on a potential initial public offering that could take place as early as next year, according to people familiar with the matter.

Crypto’s US Momentum, Trump Ties Steal Show at Hong Kong Event
items.standfirst: The Bitcoin faithful gathered in Hong Kong last week, but all eyes and energy tilted west — toward the United States, now crypto’s once-unlikely command center.
items.content: The Bitcoin faithful gathered in Hong Kong last week, but all eyes and energy tilted west — toward the United States, now crypto’s once-unlikely command center.

clusters.title: 9 former CDC directors write op-ed condemning RFK Jr.'s decisions
clusters.neutral_headline: Former CDC Directors Condemn RFK Jr.'s Decisions
bullet_summary: In a guest essay for the New York Times, the former CDC leaders said Kennedy’s actions were “unlike anything we have ever seen at the agency”
Reported by CBS News, Guardian World

items.title: 9 former CDC directors write op-ed condemning RFK Jr.'s decisions
items.standfirst: Nine former directors of the CDC have penned an op-ed for the New York Times condemning Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s decisions as "endangering every American's health." It's part of the continued fallout over the firing of the agency's director last week. Dr. Céline Gounder has more.
items.content: Nine former directors of the CDC have penned an op-ed for the New York Times condemning Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s decisions as "endangering every American's health." It's part of the continued fallout over the firing of the agency's director last week. Dr. Céline Gounder has more.

items.title: Former CDC leaders slam RFK Jr for endangering Americans’ health
items.standfirst: In a New York Times essay, nine officials said Kennedy’s leadership at HHS ‘should alarm every American’Nine former officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have said that Robert F Kennedy Jr’s leadership of the US health and human services department is “unlike anything our country has ever experienced” and “unacceptable”. They also warned that Kennedy’s leadership “should alarm every American, regardless of political leanings”.In a guest essay for the New York Times, the former CDC leaders said Kennedy’s actions were “unlike anything we have ever seen at the agency”. Continue reading...
items.content: In a New York Times essay, nine officials said Kennedy’s leadership at HHS ‘should alarm every American’Nine former officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have said that Robert F Kennedy Jr’s leadership of the US health and human services department is “unlike anything our country has ever experienced” and “unacceptable”. They also warned that Kennedy’s leadership “should alarm every American, regardless of political leanings”.In a guest essay for the New York Times, the former CDC leaders said Kennedy’s actions were “unlike anything we have ever seen at the agency”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Nine former CDC directors wrote an op-ed in the New York Times.
They condemned Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s decisions as endangering health.
The op-ed is related to the firing of the agency's director.
The former directors' actions are unlike anything seen before.
They warned Kennedy's leadership should alarm every American.

clusters.title: News outlets ‘blackout’ for Gaza to protest journalist killings
clusters.neutral_headline: News Outlets Protest Journalist Killings in Gaza
bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, Sky News World

items.title: News outlets ‘blackout’ for Gaza to protest journalist killings
items.standfirst: News outlets across the world took part in a 'blackout for Gaza' to protest Israel’s killing of journalists.
items.content: News outlets across the world took part in a 'blackout for Gaza' to protest Israel’s killing of journalists.

items.title: 'Stop killing journalists in Gaza': Media groups unite against Israeli attacks
items.standfirst: Media organisations from across the world have renewed calls for the killing of journalists in Gaza to stop - warning there will "soon be no one left to keep you informed".
items.content: Media organisations from across the world have renewed calls for the killing of journalists in Gaza to stop - warning there will "soon be no one left to keep you informed".

ai_summary: News outlets participated in a "blackout for Gaza".
The protest was against the killing of journalists by Israel.
Media organizations renewed calls to stop journalist killings.
They warned there will soon be no one left to inform.
The blackout aimed to raise awareness of the issue.
